CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1958, pg. 1 reads: "Evicted and Dejected - One of the many victims of an inadequate or nonexistent relocation housing plan for Negroes being displaced by the McKees Rocks redevelopment is 63-year-old William Banks, shown sitting dejectedly at a daughter's home. Worried sick after more than two months of futile house-hunting, the widower had to undergo hospital treatment shortly after a Redevelopment official virtually forced him to move into the street with his family of five school-age children.  "I don't know what I would have done if it hadn't been for an older daughter who took the kids in," Banks, whose right hand is paralyzed, said.  His furniture is shown stored in an abandoned building in redevelopment area. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Mattresses, furniture, and moving boxes belonging to William Banks, stored in abandoned building in McKees Rocks redevelopment area

cutline: Evicted and Dejected - One of the many victims of an inadequate or nonexistent relocation housing plan for Negroes being displaced by the McKees Rocks redevelopment is 63-year-old William Banks, shown sitting dejectedly at a daughter's home. Worried sick after more than two months of futile house-hunting, the widower had to undergo hospital treatment shortly after a Redevelopment official virtually forced him to move into the street with his family of five school-age children.  "I don't know what I would have done if it hadn't been for an older daughter who took the kids in," Banks, whose right hand is paralyzed, said.  His furniture is shown stored in an abandoned building in redevelopment area. - Harris Photos.
